title: 1878–79 Home Nations rugby union matches
text:
The 1878–79 Home Nations rugby union matches are a series of international friendlies held between the <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> and <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> national <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> teams. The only recognised competition held between the countries was the inaugural <a href="Calcutta%20Cup">Calcutta Cup</a> match, contested between England and Scotland. It was the first challenge for the Cup, and ended in an unspectacular draw.
Results.
Scoring system.
The matches for this season were decided on goals scored. A goal was awarded for a successful conversion after a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a>, for a dropped goal or for a <a href="goal%20from%20mark">goal from mark</a>. If a game was drawn, any unconverted tries were tallied to give a winner. If there was still no clear winner, the match was declared a draw.
